result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. RIEBE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

State moves to dismiss and read in this file, the defendant entered a plea in Case File 13 CF 406.  Motion granted.  
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing reset to 02-27-14 at 11:00 a.m.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-26-14 at 3:15 p.m.
Minutes.

Counsel requested and defendant referred to public defender.
Initial appearance is reset to 02-17-14 at 2:30 p.m.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-10-14 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
